Subject: energy conservation in flat flames
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=122770107
X-Yahoo-Profile: usenechal

Dear Prof. Goodwin,

when I simulate a one-dimensional, axisymmetric, premixed flame like
flame1.py and look at the results, I see that outlet temperature is
increasing with higher flow rates. To understand what happens I looked
at the specific enthalpy (molar enthalpy divided by mean molecular
weight) at every grid-point and saw that it is going down. So, if at
every grid point is the same mass flow where is the energy ? Isn't the
flame adiabtic ?

best regards
ulf
